content.question: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 1, of, the fraction with numerator 3 times x cubed, plus 2 times x squared, plus 3 x, plus 3, and denominator x squared, plus 1, end fraction, d x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 7 over 2, end fraction, plus the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 7 over 2, end fraction, plus the fraction pi over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 7 over 2, end fraction, plus the fraction pi over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.10: Integrating Functions Using Long Division and Completing the Square

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
